item.title: Business Phone Goes Hosted
item.description:
The evolution of business phone systems has progressed from basic single-line setups to intricate PBX systems accommodating numerous phones. However, the latest advancement isn’t about bigger in-house systems but rather a shift towards hosted solutions. Hosted business phone, also known as cloud-based phone service, involves a provider managing your phone system on their equipment. Essentially, the responsibility of operating the PBX and connecting to the public phone network shifts from your company to the provider...

item.title: Should You Buy VoIP as a Service?
item.description:
Cloud-based services, including Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP), have been around for a while. What’s becoming more popular now is the trend of large businesses connecting their different locations using SIP Trunks and all sizes of businesses choosing to outsource their PBX functionality. This can be considered VoIP as a Service. Many home and small business users adopted cloud-based VoIP early on to cut costs. They did this by replacing their traditional phone lines and using their broadband internet connection for both high-speed internet and phone service...
